H0.text: Deposition is the process that turns a large rock into a pile of smaller stones.

H1.text: Sedimentation is the process that turns a large rock into a pile of smaller stones.

H2.text: Fossilizing is the process that turns a large rock into a pile of smaller stones.

H3.text: Weathering is the process that turns a large rock into a pile of smaller stones.

A4.text: Over time, sheets of rock break away from the exposed rocks along the fractures, a process known as exfoliation.

A5.text: Physical weathering, also called Mechanical weathering or disaggregation, is the class of processes that causes the disintegration of rocks without chemical change.
